Package chess

Class Move

java.lang.Object
chess.Move
public class Move
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles move objects. Move objects are created when a user enters in a move, and consist of the original position of the piece, and the ending position where the piece is being moved to.

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move​(java.lang.String originalPosition, java.lang.String endingPosition, model.Board board, boolean whiteTurn)
      Class constructor for a move object.
      Parameters:
      originalPosition - The string representing the position of the piece to be moved, in filerank notation.
      endingPosition - The string representing the piece is moving to, in filerank notation.
      board - The board object representing the chess board.
      whiteTurn - A boolean, true if it's white team's turn, false if it's black team's turn.

  • Method Details

    • getOriginalPosition

      public java.lang.String getOriginalPosition()
      Getter method to get the starting position of the piece, in filerank notation.
      Returns:
      this move's original position.

    • getEndingPosition

      public java.lang.String getEndingPosition()
      Getter method to get the position resulting from the move, in filerank notation.
      Returns:
      this move's ending position.

    • getBoard

      public model.Board getBoard()
      Getter method to get the board.
      Returns:
      board object representing the board.

    • isWhiteTurn

      public boolean isWhiteTurn()
      Getter method to see which team is making this move.
      Returns:
      boolean representing this move's team. True if the white team made this move, false if the black team made this move.

    • setWhiteTurn

      public void setWhiteTurn()
      Sets the turn to the opposite team's turn. If the white team made this move, then sets the move to the black team.

      Used the most in validateMove.

    • validateMove

      public java.lang.String validateMove()
      Gets all possible moves that can be made for the current team by calling getPossibleMoves. Gets all impossible moves, which are moves that put, or keep the king in check by calling getImpossibleMoves.
      Returns:
      string "invalid" if this object's move is an impossible move. string "check" if this object's move put the other team's king in check. string "checkmate" if this object's move put the other team in checkmate. string "valid" if neither check or checkmate, and the move is a valid move.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      string representation of the move object. Formatted as "originalPosition to endingPosition"
